snippet: Since a huge landslide in March, questions about the impact on tourism have hung over the mountain town of Darrington, Wash. So far, leaders and residents say, the news is encouraging.
abstract: Questions about the impact of a huge landslide in March on summer tourism have hung over the isolated mountain town of Darrington, Wash; landslide killed more than 40 people and cut town of 1,400 off from its southern access route; so far, however, town leaders, residents and business owners remain hopeful, reporting encouraging news in ticket sales for summer events and ripple of positive economic indicators.
lead_paragraph: Since a huge landslide in March, questions about the impact on tourism have hung over the mountain town of Darrington, Wash. So far, leaders and residents say, the news is encouraging.

headline.main: Months After Washington Landslide, Hopeful Steps Forward
headline.print_headline: Months After Washington Landslide, Hopeful Steps Forward
